before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"2cmv7","text":"We strongly recommend wearing gloves and using nuclease-free tubes and reagents to avoid RNase contamination. Further recommendations for avoiding ribonuclease contamination can be found here.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":187,"length":4}],"data":{}},{"key":"e52k2","text":"Reactions are typically 30 μl but can be scaled up as needed. Reactions should be assembled in nuclease-free microfuge tubes or PCR strip tubes.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d5go6","text":"It is essential to keep the molar ratio of Cas9 and sgRNA per target site at 10:10:1 or higher to obtain the best cleavage efficiency. A calculator can be found here.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":161,"length":4}],"data":{}},{"key":"6u298","text":"If planning to use higher concentration Cas9 Nuclease, S. pyogenes (NEB #M0386T and NEB #M0386M) for in vitro digestion of DNA, the enzyme can be diluted to   in   and used immediately.  If the 1 µM dilution will be stored at  , it should be diluted using Diluent B (NEB #B8002S):  ,  ,  ,  ,    and   (  @  ) prior to the reaction assembly.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":55,"length":12},{"style":"italic","offset":101,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":157,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":162,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":226,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":281,"length":1},{"key":6,"offset":284,"length":1},{"key":7,"offset":287,"length":1},{"key":8,"offset":290,"length":1},{"key":9,"offset":293,"length":1},{"key":10,"offset":300,"length":1},{"key":11,"offset":303,"length":1},{"key":12,"offset":307,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"5C756CA97F4411EAB7F70242AC110004","url":"https://www.neb.com/tools-and-resources/usage-guidelines/avoiding-ribonuclease-contamination"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"5C756C357F4411EAB7F70242AC110004","url":"http://nebiocalculator.neb.com"}},"10":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"50","guid":"0CC050609F3311EAB6C4BF40530AE1FB","id":0,"label":"glycerol description: {"blocks":[{"key":"eahsv","text":"Cas9 Nuclease, S. pyogenes, (Cas9) is a double-stranded DNA endonuclease that is guided to its target by sequence complementarity of a small RNA loaded into the protein. This protocol describes how to digest double-stranded DNA in vitro using Cas9 and a single guide RNA (sgRNA).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":15,"length":11},{"style":"italic","offset":228,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"370ng","text":"REFERENCES:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ch94r","text":"Jinek et al. (2012) Science 337 (6096) 816-821.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8sg2j","text":"Larson et al. (2013) Nature Protocol 8 (2180-2196).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7k0ic","text":"Mali et al. (2013) Science 339 (6121): 823-826.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
